Definately.

Although, I've been moderating forums for years now, it seems that forums without a chat section are less likely to become corrupt by useless fights etc. If there isn't a reason given to members to chat about nothing other than the software (Or purpose of the site), then they'll usually keep on topic.

It's easier to moderate a community without a chat section, but if there's a chat section, you usually spend more time moderating that, and miss out important things that actually [b:1xo33tew]need[/b:1xo33tew] to be moderated in the other forums.

In this case, moderators usually ignore chat forums, and let it all fire out, which makes the community look bad, and gives people reason to argue in other forums.

wooooow, it's all a big mess!

There are pleanty of chat sites and forums for general chat and flaming, this forum doesn't need one. If it lacked a chat forum, people would surely (or atleast mostly) stay on topic, providing the moderators kept strict rules on the other forums.

I am also working on Get Out of the Really Big House [currently working title]. It's the sequel to my first-ever game on Quest....well first game ever anywhere actually!

I started another game called Bonesaw. It's a comedy/horror. Strange combo but I think it'll be good. If I get cracking, I might be able to submit it in the IF contest. I don't know if I'm going to be able to make it though. We'll see.
